alert.note: Alert for Renville (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 4:38PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL RENVILLE COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 437 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles northwest of Fairfax to 7 miles north of Redwood Falls. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Olivia, Renville, Hector, Bird Island, Buffalo Lake, Danube, and Bechyn. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 64 and 95. U.S. Highway 71 between mile markers 86 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in the Twin Cities.
